definitions: to a very large extent or degree when modifying verbs or adjectives
examples: The new policy greatly improved employee satisfaction
Your support would be greatly appreciated by everyone

definitions: informal intensifier meaning far or much when modifying adverbs or prepositions
by a great amount or to a great extent in informal usage
examples: The estimate was way off the actual cost
She lives way out in the countryside
That movie was way better than expected
He's way ahead of the competition now

definitions: in a way that does not change; always behaving or happening in similar way
examples: She consistently arrives at work before eight o'clock
The team has consistently performed well this season

definitions: for a short time; using few words when speaking or writing
examples: He briefly explained the new procedure to us
We stopped briefly at the gas station for fuel

definitions: in or to whatever place; used to indicate location doesn't matter
examples: You can sit wherever you find an empty seat
Wherever she goes, her dog follows her loyally

definitions: appearing to be true or real but perhaps not actually so
examples: The seemingly simple problem took hours to solve
He was seemingly unaffected by the harsh criticism

definitions: happening or changing slowly over a long period rather than suddenly
examples: The pain gradually decreased after taking the medicine
She gradually gained confidence in her new role

definitions: taking everything into account; considering all aspects of something as a whole
examples: Overall, the project was successful despite some setbacks
The overall performance of the team was excellent

definitions: in or to a foreign country or countries; outside one's own country
examples: They spent their summer vacation traveling abroad
Many students choose to study abroad for a semester

definitions: happening, done, or produced every day or every weekday
examples: She exercises daily to maintain her fitness level
The newspaper is delivered daily except on Sundays

definitions: in a formal and public way; with the authority of government or organization
examples: The new law was officially announced yesterday morning
She hasn't officially accepted the job offer yet

definitions: to the degree or extent indicated; used with gestures showing amount
examples: The water came up this high during the flood
I didn't expect the box to be this heavy

definitions: in a way that causes surprise because it was not expected
examples: The exam was surprisingly easy compared to previous years
Surprisingly, no one complained about the schedule change

definitions: in a way that is accurate, true, or free from errors
examples: Please spell your name correctly on the form
She correctly predicted the outcome of the election

definitions: very often; by most people; as a usual or frequent occurrence
examples: This mistake is commonly made by beginning students
Tomatoes are commonly used in Mediterranean cooking recipes

definitions: suddenly and rudely; in an abrupt manner when stopping or interrupting
examples: The meeting was cut short by the fire alarm
He stopped short when he saw the danger ahead

definitions: in spite of what has just been said; nevertheless or however
examples: The weather was terrible; nonetheless, we enjoyed our trip
It was expensive, but she bought it nonetheless

definitions: on or to a floor above the ground floor of a building
in or to a higher position of authority or management level
examples: The children are playing upstairs in their bedroom
She lives upstairs in the apartment above mine
The decision needs to go upstairs for final approval
He was promoted upstairs to senior management position

definitions: very nearly; almost entirely or completely in effect
in a practical manner; concerned with actual use rather than theory
examples: The store was practically empty at closing time
It's practically impossible to get tickets now
She approached the problem practically rather than emotionally
We need to think practically about our budget

definitions: in a very sudden or noticeable way; strikingly or remarkably
examples: Prices have increased dramatically over the past year
The situation changed dramatically when new evidence appeared

definitions: so as to pass by or go beyond something in movement
examples: The car drove past without stopping at all
She walked past the store without noticing the sign

definitions: in a way that has great significance or consequence; used to emphasize
examples: More importantly, we need to consider the long-term effects
She spoke importantly about the need for change

definitions: at exactly the same time; occurring or operating at the same time
examples: The two events occurred simultaneously in different cities
She was simultaneously working and studying for her degree

definitions: at all; to any extent; used for emphasis in questions and negatives
examples: I don't like it any better than you do
Is the situation any clearer now than before?

definitions: in an energetic or vigorous way; taking deliberate action or participation
examples: She actively participates in all community service projects
The company is actively recruiting new software developers

definitions: throughout history or in the past; concerning past events
as shown by history; based on analysis of past events
examples: Historically, this region has experienced many conflicts
Women have historically been underrepresented in science
The data shows historically low unemployment rates
This is historically accurate according to the records

definitions: on the most recent occasion before the present
after all others in time or order; finally
examples: When did you last visit your hometown?
I last saw him at the conference
He finished last in the marathon race
Add the cream last to prevent curdling

definitions: gently, delicately, or with little force or pressure
without serious consideration; treating something as unimportant
examples: She touched his shoulder lightly to wake him
Snow was falling lightly throughout the morning
Don't take my warnings lightly about this issue
He spoke lightly of his remarkable achievements

definitions: at some time in the future; on unspecified future date
examples: Someday I hope to travel around the world
She believes she'll be famous someday soon

definitions: in a way that conforms to or is permitted by law
examples: They are legally married in all fifty states
You cannot legally park here without a permit

definitions: by that means; as a result of that action or situation
examples: He failed to submit the form, thereby losing his chance
She resigned, thereby creating a vacancy on the board

definitions: at or to a short distance away; close by
almost; to the point of being something
examples: Don't stand too near the edge of the cliff
The hotel is located near the city center
She came near to winning the championship
The project is near completion after months of work

definitions: in a way that relates to physical attraction or intimate physical contact
examples: The movie contains sexually explicit scenes throughout
He was sexually harassed by his former supervisor

definitions: completely; totally; used for emphasis of completeness
taking everything into consideration; when counting all items
examples: I'm not altogether sure about this decision
She stopped smoking altogether last year
There were altogether twenty people at the meeting
How much do I owe you altogether?

definitions: informal contraction of 'kind of' meaning somewhat, rather, or to some extent
examples: I'm kinda tired after working all day
That movie was kinda boring, don't you think?

definitions: in a satisfactory or adequate manner; informal variant of 'all right'
examples: Everything turned out alright in the end
She's doing alright in her new job position

definitions: at once; without any delay; happening in an instant
examples: The pain disappeared instantly after taking the medication
She instantly recognized her old friend's voice

definitions: according to what some people say; as stated in reports
examples: The company is reportedly planning major layoffs soon
He reportedly earned millions from the deal

definitions: informal adverb meaning well, properly, or thoroughly; nonstandard but common
examples: Make sure you mix it good before serving
She cleaned the room good for the inspection

definitions: according to what is generally assumed or believed but perhaps not true
examples: The supposedly secure system was easily hacked
He's supposedly an expert, but I have doubts

definitions: in a way that is safe from harm, danger, or risk
examples: Please drive safely in these weather conditions
The children arrived home safely after the field trip

definitions: used to convey that something is claimed but not proven true
examples: He allegedly stole thousands from the company funds
The allegedly haunted house attracted many curious visitors

definitions: not involving anyone or anything else; only or exclusively
examples: She is solely responsible for this project's success
The decision was based solely on financial considerations

definitions: not far away; in the area close to a place
examples: There's a grocery store nearby if you need anything
He lives nearby, just two blocks from here

definitions: in a thorough manner; completely and with great attention to detail
examples: Please read the contract thoroughly before signing it
The police thoroughly investigated every lead in the case

definitions: in the same way; similarly to what has been stated
also; moreover; used to add similar information
examples: You're tired and I likewise need some rest
Treat others with respect and they'll likewise respect you
The first chapter was boring; likewise, the second disappointed
I enjoyed the movie and likewise the book

definitions: in a way that relates to the mind or intellectual capacity
examples: She's mentally preparing herself for the challenging exam
The accident left him mentally and physically exhausted

definitions: according to tradition; in a way that follows long-established customs
examples: The ceremony is traditionally held in early spring
Men traditionally wore suits to business meetings

definitions: in a way that is below an acceptable standard; badly
examples: The student performed poorly on the final exam
This machine has been functioning poorly lately

definitions: in a strong, steady way; securely and tightly
with resolution and determination; not changing one's mind
examples: Hold the rope firmly with both hands
The post was firmly planted in the ground
She firmly believes in equal rights for all
He firmly refused to change his position
